bibl.title: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to Philip Showalter Hench, October 7, 1940

div1.p: Hutchison informs Hench that Cooke cannot attend the Lazear memorial event. He thinks that Hench need not revise his speech.

div1.head: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to Philip Showalter Hench, October 7, 1940

opener.dateline:
THE PRESIDENT'S OFFICE
WASHINGTON AND JEFFERSON COLLEGE
WASHINGTON, PENNSYLVANIA
October 7, 1940

div1.p:
Thank you for your letter of the fifth.
We are glad to have a long invitation list. We
think it is fine for the College and I believe no
one will think you are advertising yourself.

We have a telegram today from Doctor
Cooke that he cannot come due to responsibilities
there. I am glad we have invited him but sorry he
cannot be here. I had no idea from the beginning
that his part was any less dangerous, so far as they
knew then, than that taken by the others. My only
hesitancy was based upon a report of some difference
of opinion which he had with Doctor Reed. In any
case, that's settled.

I think you need not revamp your talk
too much. I think you should describe the incident
and the discoveries which you have made just as you
originally planned it.

Thank you for the photographs which we
will get to work on the minute they come. They have
not yet arrived, but will be in tonight or tomorrow
morning.

I just got back from a trip up to New
England and am going back to Philadelphia and Princeton
tomorrow, but in between trips I try to get a little
work done.
div1.closer:
Fraternally yours, Hutch Doctor Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
